subject: Re: [Radiance-general] genbox problem - Ubuntu 7.10To: Radiance general discussion <radiance-general@radiance-online.org>
body:
Hi,

Thank you Greg,

I was wondering that was referring to a changed command.
(like rview.....). Sorry for that ...  :-(


BTW, I'd like to say thanks to all people here for this amazing and very
kind team of experts in a fantastic software like RADIANCE.
And thank you specially for your great job!

Regards from Brazil,

Vangelis

PS: I'm an architect, I was born in Greece and living in Brazil for a long
time.
I'm writing my PHD thesis about Real-time interactive visualization of
Global illumination in the process of building design.
And I'd appreciate to talk about it if anyone else wants to go over the
theme.

XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
Message-ID: <1203015365.14737.8.camel@evangelos-desktop>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

Dear sirs.,

I have a strange problem with command "genbox" running Ubuntu 7.10.
Its asking to install GROMACS application when I call the Radiance
command genbox!!!!

Any help, pD:ease?

thank you,

Vangelis
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX



------------------------------

Message: 4
Message-ID: <25684765-33CE-473D-B638-8F3EA3DE7A8D@lmi.net>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; delsp=yes; format=flowed

I think there may be a name collision.  Enter "which genbox" and if
it doesn't point to the Radiance installed one, then it's something
else.  You can re-order your PATH environment variable to pick up the
Radiance one first.

-Greg
